description: There are many situations where it would be useful to be able to publish multi-dimensional data, such as statistics, on the web in such a way that it can be linked to related data sets and concepts.  The Data Cube vocabulary provides a means to do this using the W3C [RDF](http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-rdf-syntax/) (Resource Description Framework) standard.  The model underpinning the Data Cube vocabulary is compatible with the cube model that underlies [SDMX](http://sdmx.org/) (Statistical Data and Metadata eXchange), an ISO standard for exchanging and sharing statistical data and metadata among organizations.  The Data Cube vocabulary is a core foundation which supports extension vocabularies to enable publication of other aspects of statistical data flows or other multi-dimensional data sets.

Attachable.label: Attachable (abstract)
Attachable.description: Abstract superclass for everything that can have attributes and dimensions

AttributeProperty.label: Attribute property
AttributeProperty.description: The class of components which represent attributes of observations in the cube, e.g. unit of measurement

ComponentProperty.label: Component property (abstract)
ComponentProperty.description: Abstract super-property of all properties representing dimensions, attributes or measures

ComponentSet.label: Component set
ComponentSet.description: Abstract class of things which reference one or more ComponentProperties

ComponentSpecification.label: Component specification
ComponentSpecification.description: Used to define properties of a component (attribute, dimension etc) which are specific to its usage in a DSD.

DataSet.label: Data set
DataSet.description: Represents a collection of observations, possibly organized into various slices, conforming to some common dimensional structure.

DataStructureDefinition.label: Data structure definition
DataStructureDefinition.description: Defines the structure of a DataSet or slice

DimensionProperty.label: Dimension property
DimensionProperty.description: The class of components which represent the dimensions of the cube

HierarchicalCodeList.label: Hierarchical Code List
HierarchicalCodeList.description: Represents a generalized hierarchy of concepts which can be used for coding. The hierarchy is defined by one or more roots together with a property which relates concepts in the hierarchy to thier child concept .  The same concepts may be members of multiple hierarchies provided that different qb:parentChildProperty values are used for each hierarchy.

MeasureProperty.label: Measure property
MeasureProperty.description: The class of components which represent the measured value of the phenomenon being observed

Observation.label: Observation
Observation.description: A single observation in the cube, may have one or more associated measured values

ObservationGroup.label: Observation Group
ObservationGroup.description: A, possibly arbitrary, group of observations.

Slice.label: Slice
Slice.description: Denotes a subset of a DataSet defined by fixing a subset of the dimensional values, component properties on the Slice

SliceKey.label: Slice key
SliceKey.description: Denotes a subset of the component properties of a DataSet which are fixed in the corresponding slices

attribute.label: attribute
attribute.description: An alternative to qb:componentProperty which makes explicit that the component is a attribute

codeList.label: code list
codeList.description: gives the code list associated with a CodedProperty

component.label: component specification
component.description: indicates a component specification which is included in the structure of the dataset

componentAttachment.label: component attachment
componentAttachment.description: Indicates the level at which the component property should be attached, this might an qb:DataSet, qb:Slice or qb:Observation, or a qb:MeasureProperty.

componentProperty.label: component
componentProperty.description: indicates a ComponentProperty (i.e. attribute/dimension) expected on a DataSet, or a dimension fixed in a SliceKey

componentRequired.label: component required
componentRequired.description: Indicates whether a component property is required (true) or optional (false) in the context of a DSD. Only applicable    to components correspond to an attribute. Defaults to false (optional).

concept.label: concept
concept.description: gives the concept which is being measured or indicated by a ComponentProperty

dataSet.label: data set
dataSet.description: indicates the data set of which this observation is a part

dimension.label: dimension
dimension.description: An alternative to qb:componentProperty which makes explicit that the component is a dimension

hierarchyRoot.description: Specifies a root of the hierarchy. A hierarchy may have multiple roots but must have at least one.

measure.label: measure
measure.description: An alternative to qb:componentProperty which makes explicit that the component is a measure

measureDimension.label: measure dimension
measureDimension.description: An alternative to qb:componentProperty which makes explicit that the component is a measure dimension

measureType.label: measure type
measureType.description: Generic measure dimension, the value of this dimension indicates which measure (from the set of measures in the DSD) is being given by the obsValue (or other primary measure)

observation.label: observation
observation.description: indicates a observation contained within this slice of the data set

observationGroup.label: observation group
observationGroup.description: Indicates a group of observations. The domain of this property is left open so that a group may be attached to different resources and need not be restricted to a single DataSet

order.label: order
order.description: indicates a priority order for the components of sets with this structure, used to guide presentations - lower order numbers come before higher numbers, un-numbered components come last

parentChildProperty.label: parent-child property
parentChildProperty.description: Specifies a property which relates a parent concept in the hierarchy to a child concept.

slice.label: slice
slice.description: Indicates a subset of a DataSet defined by fixing a subset of the dimensional values

sliceKey.label: slice key
sliceKey.description: indicates a slice key which is used for slices in this dataset

sliceStructure.label: slice structure
sliceStructure.description: indicates the sub-key corresponding to this slice

structure.label: structure
structure.description: indicates the structure to which this data set conforms
